page.title: 09Eccleston C.P. School
page.content: The increasing population of Eccleston resulted in a new school being built in 1969.It was built on the site of Sharples House Farm.New houses had already been built on the land which had belonged to the farm. The school is surrounded by playing fields.A small area of woodland, which was once known as Banks Wood, has been preserved as a nature area,where children can study wildlife.The school has 7 classrooms, at present accomodating 210 children, 9 teachers,1 secretary and 2 ancillary assistants. The school has its own kitchen and staff, but most children bring food from home for the mid-day meal. The oldest children have an opportunity to go on a school holiday each year. This year Whitby was chosen.
